page.title: 01THE AREA AROUND FELMINGHAM
page.content: The area is mainly arable farming, with some livestock. To the west of Felmingham is a heath, much used for walking, and the now abandoned railway line has been made into part of the Weaver's Way Walk. To the South-west is a large plantation of mainly pines which are used in the construction trade and for fencing. Felmingham is a compact, residential village with a population of about 600 built around{the Chuch and the {Village Hall}but with no school. It has a{Shop & a Pottery.}Local decisions are made by{the Parish {Council. } Skeyton and Westwick are widespread areas of small communtities but with no main central feature. 2m to the west is the town of North Walsham.
